name: KrazyPlayLayer
description: Edit properties a level's behavior. (Formerly part of ErysEdits.)

dontFade.name: Force Don't Fade
dontFade.description: Choose an option for every object's "Don't Fade" property.

dontEnter.name: Force Don't Enter
dontEnter.description: Choose an option for every object's "Don't Enter" property.

noGlow.name: Force No Glow
noGlow.description:
Choose an option for every object's "No Glow" property.

<cy>This</c> <cr>will</c> <cy>override your preferences from RayDeeUx's</c> <cl>FrickGlow</c> <cy>mod, regardless of the object.</c>

noAudioScale.name: Force No Audio Scale
noAudioScale.description:
Choose an option for every object's "No Audio Scale" property.

<cy>This</c> <cr>will</c> <cy>override your preferences from RayDeeUx's</c> <cl>BreakingPlatforming</c> <cy>mod, regardless of the object.</c>

noEffects.name: Force No Effects
noEffects.description:
Choose an option for every object's "No Effects" property.

<cy>Please read all the options given; there's more than two options on this one!</c>
one-of: Enable on Visible, Disable on Invis.
Disable on Visible, Enable on Invis.

noObjectParticles.name: Hide Object Particles
noObjectParticles.description:
Hide the particle effects from <cr>MOST</c> objects inside a level.

<cy>(Particle objects are obviously unaffected.)</c>
<cy>This does not affect particle effects from picking up collectible items in levels.</c>
<cy>Technical limitations prevent an object with "No Particles" enabled from showing its particles.</c>

noParticlesWhenFlying.name: Hide Ship/UFO/Wave/Swing BG Particles
noParticlesWhenFlying.description: Hide the particle effects that overlay your game when as a Ship, UFO, Wave, or Swing.

noPlayerParticles.name: Hide All Player Particles
noPlayerParticles.description: Hide the particle effects from various player actions, including running on the floor, flying the ship, controlling your swing, and jumping as a robot.

noSpeedParticles.name: Hide Speed Particles
noSpeedParticles.description: Hide the particle effects from activating speed portals.

noGoldCoinParticles.name: Hide Gold Coin Particles
noGoldCoinParticles.description:
Hide the particle effects from gold coins.

<cy>This does *not* hide the particles from picking up coins.</c>

noCoinParticles.name: Hide User Coin Particles
noCoinParticles.description:
Hide the particle effects from user coins.

<cy>This does *not* hide the particles from picking up coins.</c>

noEndPortalParticles.name: Hide End Portal Particles
noEndPortalParticles.description:
Hide the particle effects from end portals in Classic levels.

<cy>This affects all items that emit particles and share the same position as the end portal's particle effects.</c>.

hideEndPortalGradient.name: Hide End Portal Gradient
hideEndPortalGradient.description: Hide the gradient/glow from the end portal.

endPortalNoSFXPlat.name: Force "No SFX" in End Trigger (Plat. Only)
endPortalNoSFXPlat.description: Override whether or not "Level Complete" SFX plays when using an End Level trigger <cy>in Platformer levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

endPortalInstantPlat.name: Force "Instant" in End Trigger (Plat. Only)
endPortalInstantPlat.description: Override whether or not the player will teleport to the end as soon as the End Level trigger's target object is on screen <cy>in Platformer levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

endPortalNoEffectsPlat.name: Force "No Effects" in End Trigger (Plat. Only)
endPortalNoEffectsPlat.description: Override whether or not visual effects will play when you reach the End Level trigger <cy>in Platformer levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

endPortalNoSFXClassic.name: Force "No SFX" in End Trigger (Classic Only)
endPortalNoSFXClassic.description: Override whether or not "Level Complete" SFX plays when using an End Level trigger <cy>in Classic levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

endPortalInstantClassic.name: Force "Instant" in End Trigger (Classic Only)
endPortalInstantClassic.description: Override whether or not the player will teleport to the end as soon as the End Level trigger's target object is on screen <cy>in Classic levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

endPortalNoEffectsClassic.name: Force "No Effects" in End Trigger (Classic Only)
endPortalNoEffectsClassic.description: Override whether or not visual effects will play when you reach the End Level trigger <cy>in Classic levels</c> <cr>only</c><cy>.</c>

disableShakeTrigger.name: Disable Shake Trigger
disableShakeTrigger.description: Disables shake triggers without disabling the shaking effect from completing levels.

hideTwoPlayer.name: Hide Two Player Guide
hideTwoPlayer.description:
Hide the Two Player guide when opening a two-player level.

<cy>This does not *skip* the delay from showing the Two Player guide, it only hides the UI elements it adds to the screen.</c>

.name: Mute Level SFX
.description:
<cl>Formerly part of ErysEdits; ported by me into Eclipse Menu.</c>

Disables SFX/Edit SFX triggers.

<cy>If Eclipse Menu is loaded, you will be asked to enable the equivalent option in Eclipse Menu, and this setting will be forcefully</c> <cr>disabled</c><cy>.</c>

muteLevelOnDeath.name: Mute Level Audio on Death
muteLevelOnDeath.description:
<cl>Formerly part of ErysEdits; ported by me into Eclipse Menu.</c>

Mutes all level audio (Music + SFX) on player death.

<cy>If Eclipse Menu is loaded, you will be asked to enable the equivalent option in Eclipse Menu, and this setting will be forcefully</c> <cr>disabled</c><cy>.</c>

muteRewardsSFX.name: Mute Rewards SFX on Death
muteRewardsSFX.description:
<cl>Formerly part of ErysEdits; ported by me into Eclipse Menu.</c>

Mutes all rewards SFX (orbs, diamonds, keys) when the player dies.

<cy>If Eclipse Menu is loaded, you will be asked to enable the equivalent option in Eclipse Menu, and this setting will be forcefully</c> <cr>disabled</c><cy>.</c>

hideLevelCompleteVFX.name: Hide Level Complete VFX
hideLevelCompleteVFX.description:
<cl>Formerly part of ErysEdits; ported by me into Eclipse Menu.</c>

Hides the explosion, fireworks, and particles seen when completing a level.

<cy>If Eclipse Menu is loaded, you will be asked to enable the equivalent option in Eclipse Menu, and this setting will be forcefully</c> <cr>disabled</c><cy>.</c>

issues.info: Ping me <cl>(@erymanthus)</c> in the Geode SDK Discord server's <cl>#help</c> channel if you need help. <cr>DMs are NOT accepted.</c>
